# Recipe: Oven Cheesy Au Gratin Potatoes

## Introduction
Oven Cheesy Au Gratin Potatoes is a classic dish that combines thinly sliced potatoes with a creamy, cheesy sauce. It is a popular side dish in many cuisines and is often served with roasted meats or as part of a holiday meal. The potatoes become tender and flavorful as they bake in the oven, while the cheese sauce adds richness and a deliciously gooey texture.

## Ingredients
- 4 large potatoes, peeled and thinly sliced
- 1 cup shredded cheddar cheese
- 1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese
- 1 cup heavy cream
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 2 tablespoons butter
- 1 tablespoon all-purpose flour
- Salt and pepper to taste

## Equipment
- Oven
- Baking dish
- Mixing bowl
- Whisk
- Knife
- Cutting board

## Preparation Time
- 15 minutes

## Cooking Time
- 1 hour

## Steps
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat.
3. Add the minced garlic to the melted butter and sauté for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
4. Stir in the flour and cook for another minute, stirring constantly.
5. Gradually whisk in the heavy cream, ensuring there are no lumps.
6. Continue cooking the sauce over medium heat until it thickens, about 5 minutes.
7. Remove the saucepan from the heat and stir in the shredded cheddar and mozzarella cheeses until melted and smooth.
8. Season the cheese sauce with salt and pepper to taste.
9. Layer half of the sliced potatoes in a greased baking dish.
10. Pour half of the cheese sauce over the potatoes, spreading it evenly.
11. Layer the remaining sliced potatoes on top and pour the remaining cheese sauce over them.
12. Cover the baking dish with foil and bake in the preheated oven for 45 minutes.
13. Remove the foil and bake for an additional 15 minutes, or until the potatoes are tender and the top is golden and bubbly.
14. Let the dish cool for a few minutes before serving.

## Serving Suggestions
- Serve the Oven Cheesy Au Gratin Potatoes as a side dish with roasted chicken or beef.
- Pair it with a fresh salad or steamed vegetables for a complete meal.

## Variations
- Add cooked bacon or ham to the layers of potatoes for a meaty twist.
- Sprinkle some chopped fresh herbs, such as parsley or chives, on top before baking for added flavor and freshness.

## Tips and Tricks
- Use a mandoline slicer to achieve uniformly thin potato slices.
- To prevent the top from browning too quickly, cover the dish with foil for the first half of the baking time.
- For a crispier top, broil the dish for a few minutes at the end of the baking time.

## Nutritional Information
- Calories: 350 per serving
- Fat: 22g
- Carbohydrates: 28g
- Protein: 10g

## Storage and Leftovers
- Store any leftovers in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.
- Reheat the leftovers in the oven or microwave until heated through.

## Frequently Asked Questions
- Can I use different types of cheese?
  - Yes, you can experiment with different cheeses to customize the flavor. Gruyere, fontina, or Monterey Jack are great alternatives.
- Can I make this dish ahead of time?
  - Yes, you can assemble the dish ahead of time and refrigerate it. Just increase the baking time by 10-15 minutes to ensure the potatoes are fully cooked.
- Can I freeze this dish?
  - While it is possible to freeze the dish, the texture of the potatoes may change slightly upon thawing. It is best enjoyed fresh.
